issue.title: Multiple cursors + Word wrap

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

issue.body:
The current behaviour in VSCode with `"editor.wordWrap": "on" ` is like this:
![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5332158/19222557/a85d2168-8e31-11e6-985a-e328a6c3b11c.gif)

But I would prefer an option for this
![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5332158/20053063/ffbafc3a-a4bd-11e6-9f92-80733ca6c606.gif)

Note I used the gif from [here](https://github.com/SublimeTextIssues/Core/issues/1054) which I found while looking for a solution.

comment.body: Would also like to see the default behaviour reversed.

issue.title: inotifywait occasionally reports zero-length file
issue.body:
Issue Type: Bug Setup: ```bash mkdir repro cd repro git init touch test.txt cat > watch << EOF #!/bin/bash path=test.txt while inotifywait -e modify $path; do stat --printf="%s" $path done EOF chmod +x watch code . ``` Inside VSCode, open `test.txt` and open an integrated terminal with ``Ctrl+` ``. Inside the integrated terminal, start the watcher script with `./watch`. Now make repeated edits to `test.txt`. Occasionally the watcher script will report that the file has zero-length. VS Code version: Code 1.29.1 (bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e, 2018-11-15T19:07:43.495Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.15.0-38-generic
System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6600U CPU @ 2.60GHz (4 x 2700)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled

issue.title: PHP Xdebug not working
issue.body:
Hi, I'm using VSCODE in Ubuntu 18.04. I have php and xdebug installed, and they are both working (!).
It just happens that Xdebug does not receive my code! I'll tell you how I know: if I run
   netstat --listen | grep 9000
the result is an empty line. If I launch the debugger in vscode and run the same command again, the output is
   tcp6       0      0 [::]:9000               [::]:*                  LISTEN 
In vscode, the debug console becomes active: if I write "Is Xdebug working?" (without the quotes), the answer is "Cannot evaluate code without a connection". If I write "printf("Hello World!");" the answer is "Cannot evaluate code without a connection". Well... the connection is alive, is just does not get my code :-(.
I tried several things, namely, using putty to create ssh tunnels over port 9000. No Joy!

Any idea what might be wrong? phpinfo() returns the usual correct status, php -v reports that Xdebug is active... it simply is not receiving my code...

Best regards,
Licínio Nunes

issue.title: please dont bloat VS Studio - remove default commit ghost info on idling cursor
issue.body: Issue Type: Feature Request I dont know whose idea is it that I want to see the name and date of every git commit every time my cursor blinks on a line. Bugs the heck out of me. This mustve been added recently. It should be on only if requested; it isnt useful 99.9% of the time. VS Code version: Code 1.29.1 (bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e, 2018-11-15T19:07:43.495Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.10.0-28-generic

issue.title: please dont bloat VS Studio - remove default commit ghost info on idling cursor
issue.body: Issue Type: Feature Request I dont know whose idea is it that I want to see the name and date of every git commit every time my cursor blinks on a line. Bugs the heck out of me. This mustve been added recently. It should be on only if requested; it isnt useful 99.9% of the time. VS Code version: Code 1.29.1 (bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e, 2018-11-15T19:07:43.495Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.10.0-28-generic

comment.body:
My bad. you are right; sorry microsoft; i bloated this not you ;)
Im using GitHistory Diff extension - which is useful at times.
It seems that un checking Settings Githd> Blame View/ show git blame information for each line; will fix the issue.

issue.title: Allow for floating windows
issue.body:
Hi,
I suggest floating windows option for:
- Terminal
- Debug console
- Problems
- Output

Eventually:
- tabs
- Explorer / search / debug / git / extensions 

This way we could take advantage of large screen space and / or multi monitors.

Having to constantly switch between the various windows is not optimum working flow.

comment.body: Until VS Code has multiple display support I do not see moving to this editor as my default.  I recently, started using JetBrains tools as an alternative.  I have been watching this issue for year + and still no movement on this.  I am not sure why the delay?

issue.title: API Access to "Open Editors"
issue.body: I have a use case where I would like to be able to get a list of all the open editors (basically exactly what is shown here). I understand that Editors are disposed but I just need a list of filenames. Something like: `workspace.openDocuments:Array` or even just `workspace.openFiles:Array`. Long term, it might be nice to have API access to operate on this list (EG: sort open editors pane by last opened, name, etc).

comment.body: As the [fifth highest voted open issue for the API](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Areactions-%2B1-desc+label%3Aapi), I hope to see this in the VS Code Roadmap 2019 as the final release of 2018 wraps up in the few weeks.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

issue.title: Quick Open: Is not returning any files in workspace
issue.body:
VS Code: Oct release
OS : Windows 10

Quick Open is not working at all.
It used to work but has never been reliable, but in general i rely on browsing for file in Explorer. I have tried excluding folders from the search to speed it up with limited success.

I use a network drive which maps to file server. the project area is large.

Currently when i perform Ctrl-P it only returns recently opened. Never does  it find files.

I did the following
Set Log Level - Trace.
Ran quick open.
the following is trace

[2018-11-14 06:26:43.898] [renderer1] [trace] CommandService#executeCommand workbench.action.quickOpen
[2018-11-14 06:26:43.913] [renderer1] [trace] telemetry/workbenchActionExecuted {"id":"workbench.action.quickOpen","from":"keybinding"}
[2018-11-14 06:26:45.749] [renderer1] [trace] SearchService#search: 106ms
[2018-11-14 06:27:03.694] [renderer1] [trace] SearchService#search: 17729ms
[2018-11-14 06:37:07.385] [renderer1] [trace] SearchService#search: 840817ms
[2018-11-14 06:37:07.386] [renderer1] [trace] telemetry/searchComplete {"reason":"startFileSearch","resultCount":1,"workspaceFolderCount":1,"type":"searchProcess","endToEndTime":840817,"traversal":"Ripgrep","fileWalkTime":839267,"directoriesWalked":0,"filesWalked":0,"cmdTime":839265,"cmdResultCount":1,"scheme":"file","useRipgrep":true}
[2018-11-14 06:39:18.147] [renderer1] [trace] SearchService#search: 877367ms
[2018-11-14 06:39:18.148] [renderer1] [trace] telemetry/searchComplete {"reason":"openFileHandler","resultCount":0,"workspaceFolderCount":1,"type":"searchProcess","endToEndTime":877367,"sortingTime":-1,"traversal":"Ripgrep","fileWalkTime":877253,"directoriesWalked":0,"filesWalked":0,"cmdTime":877252,"cmdResultCount":23723,"scheme":"file","useRipgrep":true}



Thx
derek

comment.body:
@roblourens what triggers the exthost to launch rg.exe? Is it a filewatcher?
You mentioned previously there is no cache, bit in the trace logs above seem to imply there is a searchcache.

issue.title: Keyboard shortcuts in the file explorer do not work as expected
issue.body:
I am using vscode 1.29.1 on a mid-2014 MacBook Pro running macOS 10.13.6.

When the file explorer is focussed:
1. cmd+a does not select all files; and
2. shift+arrows (to expand a selection) does not behave as it would in Finder.

(Bonus feature request: it'd be really cool if, like in JetBrains' IDEs, typing when the file explorer is focussed would filter the files.)

P.S. Keep up the amazing work—vscode is so good!

pull_request.title: Fixed checkForSnapUpdate in updateService.linux.ts to use environment…
pull_request.body:
This issue stems from the following discussion where it appears that the snap build of vscode by snapcrafters was throwing warnings for being outdated.

https://github.com/snapcrafters/vscode/issues/29

Credit to @meddario as he was able to identify exactly the failing function.

The main issue in this case is that product.applicationName is looking for the name 'code', whilst the SNAP is mounted under the name 'vscode'.

Using https://github.com/snapcore/snapd/wiki/Environment-Variables

It seems that the environment variable SNAP is useful for identifying the mount point for the snap.

I have tested the backtick and functionality of the new code under a node shell. 

snap connect --run vscode

The code executed as expected.

issue.title: Allow to open multiple workspaces in the same window
issue.body:
Workspace feature is great because we can grouping projects in a top context (microservices projects in a big API workspace). But, only one workspace can be open. This feature can be powerful if multiple workspaces can be open at the same time (in the same window).

![test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/895661/35967214-7cc92ba0-0cc0-11e8-82b0-6bae8c11ffdb.jpg)

And another request : it will be great if :
- Right click on the workspace name should open menu with a "settings" item (which open xxxx.code-workspace).
- Workspace settings should contain a `name` attribute (to clearly identify the workspace in the left pane in VS Code)

comment.body: @shane-smith Good catch! My mistake -- updated the post. Thanks!

issue.title: Extract the integrated terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

issue.body:
"Feature" request.

The integrated terminal grows in functionality, to the point that it could soon become very useful standalone, as its *own app*. I'm only a casual VScode user (using vim most of the time), but I would definitely be interested in a well-behaved, consistent, reactively-configurable, multi-platform terminal not tied to the editor.

Obviously if such a situation were to unfold, the shared component (not entirely dissimilar to VTE) should be jointly developed and shared with VScode. Both could be able to leverage a common configuration so that whether a terminal leveraging such a theoretical common component is spawned within VScode or standalone, they behave the same.

comment.body:
VScode Terminal as a stand-alone app would be great to have but I can see the architectural difficulties it may present and vscode team may be hesitant to it. 

Being able to undock the terminal panel as it’s own maximizable window and switch from dropdown to tabs should allievate a lot of pain. 

In multiple monitor mode, it’s nice to have terminal separately on it’s own screen.

comment.body: no, couldn't reproduce it, any idea which extension might be causing that?

issue.title: VSCode Terminal as its own window/app with tabs
issue.body:
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

With the new  `"terminal.integrated.experimentalBufferImpl": "TypedArray",` vscode integrated terminal performance is brilliant. It seems to outperform both iTerm and MacOSX's built in Terminal app.

I'd love to replace iTerm with vscode's terminal without taking the big perf hit of launching all of vscode and it's extensions.

Just like there is `code <path>` cli shortcut to launch vscode, could we have a `code-term` to launch just the terminal as its own window ?

It seems the terminal already includes split panes, search, e.t.c and tabs seem like it's under discussion. So something like below should be possible by wrapping up the integrated terminal in it's own window.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1018196/48966603-7ce8f500-ef89-11e8-986a-fb99b7425120.png)

I do a lot of development in cli apps via mosh/ssh into a remote machine, I'm guessing I'm not the only one and it's a fairly common use-case.
